_source.post_content:
Hungarian DJ/producer duo Myon & Shane 54 have been making quite the name for themselves over the past few years with their infectious mash-ups and crazy energetic sound. First setting the world alight with tracks on Armada and Anjunabeats, the two are now popping well-crafted tunes on their Ride Recordings imprint. Always showcasing new tunes on their weekly radio show International Departures, the two have just recently announced the "Summer Of Love" tour.

The Summer of Love name is no stranger to MS54 fans. The duo has been shelling out remixes under the moniker for many of their popular edits including "Young & Beautiful" by Lana Del Rey, "The Great Divide" by Velvetine, and "Sea Lo Que Sea Será" by Above & Beyond and Miguel Bosé. First invading the shores of Australia, the tour will then head over North America, hitting cities all across Canada and the United States.

Readying the release of new music as well as additional tour dates, you can expect that the "Summer Of Love" tour will be just as massive as the remixes of the same name. Join Disco Donnie Presents as we bring Myon & Shane 54's "Summer of Love" tour to a city near you:

	Myon & Shane 54 in Charlotte, NC on Friday, August 22nd
	Myon & Shane 54 in Dallas, TX on Sunday, August 24th
	Myon & Shane 54 in San Antonio, TX on Friday, September 12nd
	Myon & Shane 54 in Houston, TX on Saturday, September 13th

_source.post_title: Have a 'Summer of Love' With Myon & Shane 54 and Disco Donnie Presents

_source.post_content:
Borgeous has a lot to celebrate. Just this past year alone, the talent signed with Spinnin' Records and released a handful successful club hits and remixes including "Invincible," which nabbed most-played song on the radio and also peaked at #4 on the Billboard charts, "Stampede," "Tsunami" and his edit of Afrojack's "Ten Feet Tall." Outside of the studio, Borgeous keeps the momentum going with his performances on the road, playing to massive crowds at Tomorrowland, Electric Zoo, and even his own Las Vegas residency.

Even with a crazy tour schedule that sees him traveling around the world, Borgeous keeps wowing audiences with a steady stream of releases like his latest hit "Celebration." Dripping with Borgeous' catchy, textured sound, the accompanying video for "Celebration" captures what life has been like for the talent with insane live footage, "I just wanted to do something fun," Borgeous states, "just put together a lot of clips from my shows and of me playing 'Celebration' to everyone and put together something fun people can just listen to at a party."

Taking that party on the road, Borgeous has just announced a worldwide Celebration tour. Kicking off in New York, the tour will touchdown all over North America, Portugal, and India before eventually ending in Los Angeles. Come be a part of the celebration and join Disco Donnie Presents on our partnering dates:

	Borgeous in Houston, TX on Friday, July 25th
	Borgeous in Scottsdale, AZ on Friday, August 22nd
	Borgeous in Tallahassee, FL on Thursday, August 28th
	Borgeous in Philadelphia, PA on Saturday, October 18th


http://youtu.be/AFRi6S4KSqU
_source.post_title: Join the 'Celebration' With Borgeous and Disco Donnie Presents This Summer

_source.post_content:
If they had their way, Los Angeles-based DJs and producers Milo & Otis would have you believe they are merely a duo consisting of a professional writer of fake books and a gambling farmer leprechaun. In reality, the two talents have been catching the attention of both artists and listeners alike for their quirky blend of trap, moombahton and electro house since 2006.

Never ones to stay within the confines of what popular culture likes to hear, productions of theirs have been known to include pigeon "coos," burp sounds, and anything else that makes you laugh and dance at the same time, "We definitely try to experiment more with every new song that we make and try to always take the next song to a different level," Otis says, "Some of our new stuff is a little slower and chill and some is super crazy, and we definitely want to incorporate more vocals in the future."

Currently lending their talents on the Mothership Tour along with friends Skrillex, Dillon Francis, DJ Snake and What So Not, you can catch Milo & Otis as they break away to headline a few dates at a club near you. Join us on the dance floor this summer:

	Milo & Otis in Scottsdale, AZ on Friday, July 11th
	Milo & Otis in Houston, Texas on Saturday, July 12th
	Milo & Otis in Dallas, Texas on Sunday, July 13th
_source.post_title: Come Laugh and Groove on the Dance Floor with Milo & Otis this Summer

_source.post_content:
First introduced to dance music as a member of a dance crew called Liquid Pop Collective, when Brillz progressed into production and DJing, his liquid experience would late become the foundation of the trap lord's aesthetic.

Putting out releases on OWSLA, Mad Decent and Slow Roast Records, Brillz stood out among the rest of the trap set after releasing a full-length artist album, stating "I think like a painter or a fashion designer – I wanted to created a body of work and I wanted to make an impact."

And impact, he did. The album, titled Twonk, rapidly climbed up iTunes' dance music chart. What is twonk, you ask? "Twonk is a human weirdo and twonk team is the movement of the weirdos. Twonk is about creativity, it’s about individuality, it’s about being weird... it’s about self-expression."

Currently celebrating the release of his remix for Galantis called "You," come rock out with your twonk out as Disco Donnie Presents brings Brillz to a city near you:

	Brillz in Jacksonville, FL on Wednesday, June 11th
	Brillz in Tampa, FL on Friday, July 11th
	Brillz in San Marcos, TX on Thursday, July 24th
	Brillz in San Antonio, TX on Friday, July 25th
	Brillz in Houston, TX on Saturday, July 26th


[soundcloud url="https://api.soundcloud.com/tracks/147439009" params="color=ff5500&auto_play=false&hide_related=false&show_artwork=true&show_comments=true&show_user=true&show_reposts=false" width="100%" height="166" iframe="true" /]
_source.post_title: Get Twonkin' with Brillz and Disco Donnie Presents this Summer

_source.post_content:
Boys Noize is still amidst a worldwide journey with the Where's Your Child tour. Starting off in Liverpool on February 22nd and ending in Barcelona in June, the German talent has been making audiences sweat using his technical prowess behind the decks and his energetic blend of hip hop, disco, techno, electro, and everything else in between.

But before the tour makes its way to our partnering dates, we're launching an exclusive contest to give some fans the chance to win free tickets and Boys Noize merch.

Head on over to Jamplify, where you can sign up or login with using your Facebook or Twitter account. After you choose which date you'd like to promote for, you'll receive a personalized link to share. Share the link anywhere you have followers. We'll automatically track anyone who buys tickets from your link. The top three Jamplify promoters for the Where's Your Child tour will win:
Top Promoter

	Four (4) Tickets to partnering Where's Your Child tour date.
	Boys Noize Merchandise.

Runner Up

	Two (2) Tickets to partnering Where's Your Child tour date.
	Boys Noize Merchandise.

Third Place


	One (1) Ticket to partnering Where's Your Child tour date.
	Boys Noize Merchandise.


Our Partnering Dates

	Boys Noize in Orlando, FL on Thursday, May 15, 2014
	Boys Noize in Tampa, FL on Friday, May 16, 2014
	Boys Noize in El Paso, TX on Saturday, May 17, 2014
_source.post_title: Go Hard with Boys Noize and Become the 'Where's Your Child' Tour Top Promoter

_source.post_content:
There is a looming outbreak that will infect unsuspecting cities all across the United States this summer - and you won't even want a vaccine.

Born half zombie and half boy, bass music favorite Zomboy just announced a massive set of dates for The Outbreak Tour in late Spring and well into Summer. Friends Cookie Monsta, Eptic, and TL will be tagging along for many of the 28 dates making for an epic night of wub and filth. The tour starts in Raleigh, NC on May 22nd at Lincoln Theater and weaves its way across every corner of the country before ending in San Diego, CA and Boulder, CO in July.

With a thorough background in traditional sound engineering, Zomboy's well-crafted productions have undoubtedly helped garner quite the following in the short span of his career. His debut Game Time EP was in the top 5 of Beatport's dubstep chart for over eight weeks, within six months of the release, tracks were licensed to eight music compilations on various labels like Warner Music and Ministry of Sound - not bad for a debut, huh?

Though he's best known for his grime-flavored dubstep, the undead producer incorporates drumstep, electro, and orchestral pieces to create his unique and ever-so-loved sound. Putting the finishing touches on his album named The Outbreak, due out in July 2014, be a part of the viral outbreak and join us on our partnering dates:

	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta in Raleigh, NC on Thursday, May 22nd
	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta, TC in Charlotte, NC on Saturday, May 31st
	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta, TC in Nashville, TN on Saturday, June 7th
	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta, Eptic in Austin, TX on Thursday, July 10th
	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta, Eptic in Houston, TX on Friday, July 11th
	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta, Eptic in Dallas, TX on Saturday, July 12th
	Zomboy, Cookie Monsta, Eptic in Albuquerque, NM on Friday, July 18th
	Zomboy in Tampa, FL on Friday, August 1st


http://youtu.be/-_7PyZZpz1w
_source.post_title: A Viral 'Outbreak' is Coming to Your City! Disco Donnie Presents Joins Zomboy This Summer

_source.post_content:
With over two decades of experience, Ferry Corsten is far from a newcomer. Creating a long list of anthems over his extensive career, the Dutch talent is undeniably one of the most respected names in the music industry today.

Getting his start at the ripe young age of 16, Ferry sunk his teeth in the record business producing underground hardcore gabber tracks before eventually transitioning to the trance genre. His first single to make it on any chart was "Don't Be Afraid" under the alias Moonman - but this was only the beginning for the young talent. Under his solo project of System F, Ferry gave the world a classic in "Out of the Blue." And as Gouryella, a partnership with another trance legend, Tiësto, the two received a gold record for the track, coincidentally called, "Gouryella."

Over the years, releases like "Check It Out," "Minack," "Brute," "Punk," "Rock Your Body Rock," and "Feel It" have cemented Ferry's place among the leaders in electronic music. With his podcast #CorstenCountdown and his imprint Flashover Recordings, Ferry continues to showcase new sounds and artists to the world.

Currently, you can find Ferry in the studio, still continuing to innovate his sound and inspire new acts even after all these years. We are excited to bring Dutch DJ, producer, label owner, and self-professed music addict Ferry Corsten to a city near you.

Join us on our partnering dates:

Ferry Corsten in Dallas, TX on Friday, June 6th
Ferry Corsten in Scottsdale, EZ on Friday, June 13th
Ferry Corsten in Orlando, FL on Saturday, June 14th
Ferry Corsten in Tampa, FL on Saturday, June 21st

_source.post_content:
Hot on the heels of their latest hit "Colors," Texan trance duo Tritonal have recently announced an accompanying Colors tour featuring Paris Blohm. Heading across the US and Canada this spring and summer, come see why MTV Clubland listed Tritonal on the "10 Artists to Watch" in 2013.

Though they've only been a united production outfit for five years, Chad Cisneros and Dave Reed of progressive trance duo Tritonal have gone from virtually unknown newcomers to one of the top names in dance music today. Making their debut to the world with their artist album Piercing the Quiet, the LP produced eight top 20 Beatport singles, including five that held the #1 position on the trance chart for almost three weeks like "Lifted" and "Still With Me (Club Mix)."

Tritonians, the dedicated fan base of the duo, is ever-expanding rapidly around the globe. Audiences flock to their signature sound, and mixture of uplifting, progressive, and electrifying originals and remixes.

Kicking off the "Colors" tour in Scottsdale, Arizona, Tritonal will be making their way around every corner of the continent. Come and join us on the dance floor as we bring the colorful to a city near you:

	Tritonal, Paris Blohm in Scottsdale, AZ on Friday, March 28, 2014
	Tritonal, Seven Lions in Portland, OR on Friday, May 9, 2014
	Tritonal, Paris Blohm in Houston, TX on Saturday, May 17, 2014
	Tritonal, Paris Blohm in Tampa, FL on Saturday, June 7, 2014
	Tritonal, Paris Blohm in Nashville, TN on Friday, June 27, 2014

_source.post_content:
Producing and remixing extraordinaire, Dyro, has seen his career accelerate at a ridiculous speed. It was only back in 2011 that the then 19 year old decided to start producing, but judging by his success, it's easy to see that his level of talent for exceeds his years. When Dyro put the productions he'd been working on online, one of his own personal heroes Hardwell took notice and played a track of his at Electric Zoo. Subsequently, the track, "Metaphor," was signed to Hardwell's Revealed Recordings.

Known for creating massive progressive tracks with electro-tinged drops, Dyro knows exactly how to work that peak-time sound as heard especially in his SiriusXM show Daftastic. Closing out 2013 with mega-hits "Never Say Goodbye" and "Paradise" with Tiësto, Dyro is marching into 2014 with a new release in "Black Smoke," a slow-burning track with raw, relentless synths.

Armed with a crate full of energy, get ready to get daftastic as Disco Donnie Presents brings Dyro to a city near you!

	Dyro in Charlotte, NC on January 31, 2014
	Dyro in Dallas, TX on February 7, 2014
	Dyro in Scottsdale, AZ on March 14, 2014
	Dyro in Houston, TX on March 15, 2014

_source.post_content:
Dimitri Vegas & Like Mike are at the top of their game right now. Releasing banger after banger, the brothers are undoubtedly one of the hottest names in dance music.

Though the brothers didn't initially have the same the aspirations about their future career paths, the two first came together in 2003 after Dimitri scored residencies at clubs like Privilege and Space Ibizia. Mike, who had long been MCing hip hop for a while, started flowing on top of Dimitri's sets, just for fun. Party-goers went crazy over the sure-fire formula, but it wasn't until much later that Dimitri and Mike would feel they could commit to music fully as a career. After moving back to Belgium in 2005, the two built their studio and started focusing on producing and the rest, as they say, is history. 

Known for creating festival style anthems like "Chattahoochee," "Wakanda," and "Loops & Tings," these two are an unstoppable duo. When they aren't packing on the energy in their massive performances around the world, you can catch Dimitri Vegas & Like Mike in the studio or manning their imprint and radio show Smash The House. This February, Disco Donnie Presents is joining the brothers and heading south of the border to "Smash Mexico." Progressive duo Wolfpack will be lending their talents on the cross-country tour as well. 

Join us on our partnering dates:

Dimitri Vegas and Like Mike in Puebla, Mexico on Wednesday, February 12th
Dimitri Vegas and Like Mike in Torreon, Mexico on Thursday, February 13th
Dimitri Vegas and Like Mike in Monterrey, Mexico on Friday, February 14th
Dimitri Vegas and Like Mike in Mexico City, Mexico on Saturday, February 15th


http://youtu.be/JKv_mdD_Pig
_source.post_title: Disco Donnie Presents Joins Dimitri Vegas and Like Mike to 'Smash Mexico'
